title: What are some of the most difficult plants to commercially cultivate? - Quora

response.answer_text: Mums and Poinsettia are both intense. Mums would be one stem, one flower plants if not pinched back. They must be pinched back for best flowering, that seems like a lot of work if you have thousands. Poinsettia need 40 days of day and NIGHT (no light). That means you have to provide complete darkness for at least 12 hours a day for over a month, that might be a big problem.
Truffles. They are underground fungus and a valued as a delicacy. They cannot in fact be cultivated. But I am sure someone will figure out how soon.
